com.github.gwtd3.api.functions
Class CountFunction

java.lang.Object
  com.github.gwtd3.api.functions.CountFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatumFunction<Void>
public class CountFunction
extends Object
implements DatumFunction<Void>

A DatumFunction that counts something, mainly used as a debugging purpose in Selection.each(DatumFunction) method.

You may override the #takeIntoAccount(Element, Datum, int) to change when the count is incremented.

Author:
Anthony Schiochet

Method Detail

apply

public Void apply(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element context,
                  Value d,
                  int index)
Description copied from interface: DatumFunction
Apply the function for the given Element at the specified index of the Selection mapped to the given Datum.

Note that if no datum is mapped to the element, Datum#isUndefined() will return true.

Specified by:
apply in interface DatumFunction<Void>
Parameters:
context - the current element
d - the datum
index - the index of the element in the selection
Returns:
a result to be applied
